post.description: This is how you obtain an access token for a user. In the OAuth flow, your backend will receive a one time use "code" parameter. You will then exchange the code you received for a long lived access token by calling this endpoint.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: This should always be "authorization_code".

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: This is the code that you received to your OAuth callback as the "code" parameter. Pass it up directly

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: This is your client ID

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: This is your client secret

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: This is your redirect URL. If you are just gating your webapp, this redirect URL will be registered on your developer portal in the Whop Dashboard. If you are building general purpose software, aka an experience, this should be your "{base_url}/{your_hub_path}".

get.description: Retrieve the company object, user object, and experiences objects that are available to the user. This endpoint is useful for gathering data about the customer using your software and the company selling your software.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A user's access token, which must be retrieved from the Whop OAuth2 authentication flow. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

get.description: Retrieves the user object that for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A user's access token, which must be retrieved from the Whop OAuth2 authentication flow. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

get.description: Retrieves a list of experience objects that the authenticated user has access to.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A user's access token, which must be retrieved from the Whop OAuth2 authentication flow. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per
parameters.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

get.description: Retrieve memberships possessed by the currently authenticated user as it relates to the company selling access to the specific software.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A user's access token, which must be retrieved from the Whop OAuth2 authentication flow. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per
parameters.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

parameters.name: valid
parameters.description: Whether or not the Membership has a valid status

post.summary: Update a plan using an experience access token

201.description: Update a plan using an experience access token

get.description: Returns a collection of Products, based on the supplied filters.

parameters.name: page

parameters.name: per
parameters.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

parameters.name: expand

error.message: Parameter :example is invalid. Please ensure you are passing the correct type for this parameter.

403.description: Forbidden (Credentials not permitted to access the specified resource)

error.message: No such Resource found with the provided ID: xxx_123
Uh oh, something went wrong. This is something we need to fix, and isn't on your end. We've been notified and are working on a fix

get.description: Returns a collection of Plans, based on the supplied filters. Plans represent a pricing and release method configuration used to purchase a Product.

parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per
parameters.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: The level of visibility of the Plan

parameters.name: access_pass_id
parameters.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The Plan's Product ID, which will look like `prod_*************` or `pass_*************`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the Product on the returned Plan(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product]`

parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: expand

post.description: Create a quick link (or release link) for a plan. This will copy over all data from an existing plan and make a new plan with the same data that can be used as a one-time release link. You can change the stock and metadata on the new plan.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: mimic_plan_id
parameters.description: The ID of a plan you want to copy the data from, which will look like `plan_*************`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the Product on the returned Plan(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product]`

201.description: Create a quick link for a plan

get.description: Returns a collection of Memberships, based on the supplied filters. If a Membership is valid, the User has/should have access to the Experiences associated with the Product. If a Membership is invalid, the User will/should have their Product's Experiences unfulfilled. By default, results are returned 10 objects at a time.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per
parameters.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the Membership

parameters.name: plan_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Plan attached to this Membership, which will look like `plan_*************`

parameters.name: access_pass_id
parameters.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Product attached to this Membership, which will look like `prod_*************` or `pass_*************`

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the User that owns this Membership, which will look like `user_*************`

parameters.name: discord_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Discord account attached to this Membership

parameters.name: wallet_address
parameters.description: The crypto wallet address used to pay for the Membership (if paid through the one-time ETH or renewal WETH Whop contracts)

parameters.name: valid
parameters.description: Whether or not the Membership has a valid status

parameters.name: hide_metadata
parameters.description: Whether or not to hide the metadata returned on responses. Passing true will hide the metadata, default value is false.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to order the results by. Either 'desc' or 'asc'. Default is 'desc'.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Plan, Product, or Promo Code on the returned Membership(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, user, promo_code]`

get.description: Returns a specific Membership, using its unique ID. A Membership represents an instance of a User purchasing a Product.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Membership, which will look like `mem_*************`, or the license key of the membership.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Plan, Product, or Promo Code on the returned Membership(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, user, promo_code]`

post.description: Use the update license endpoint to add metadata like hwid to an instance of the License.

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Plan, Product, or Promo Code on the returned Membership(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, user, promo_code]`

post.summary: Add Free Days to a Membership
post.description: Extend a Membership's next renewal date or expiration date by a specified number of days. Once the Membership's updated renewal/expiration date has been reached, it will renew or expire as normal.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Membership, which will look like `mem_*************`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Plan, Product, or Promo Code on the returned Membership(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, user, promo_code]`

post.description: Terminates a specific Membership, using its unique ID. It will immediately invalidate the Membership, and the User will/should have their Product's Experiences unfulfilled. Termination is irreversible, so a User will have to re-purchase if they wish to continue their access.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Membership, which will look like `mem_*************`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Plan, Product, or Promo Code on the returned Membership(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, user, promo_code]`

post.description: Cancels a specific Membership, using its unique ID. It will set the Membership to cancel at period end.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Membership, which will look like `mem_*************`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Plan, Product, or Promo Code on the returned Membership(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, user, promo_code]`

post.description: Validate an instance of your software by sending metadata about the user.  For example, by sending metadata containing the HWID of the device most recently logged in,  you can ensure an instance of your software is only being used on one device at a time.

get.description: Returns a collection of Payments, based on the supplied filters. Only Payments with a status of paid have been successfully processed.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per
parameters.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the Payment

parameters.name: membership_id
parameters.description: The Membership this Payment part of. By default this will just be the ID of the Membership, but you can expand it to get more information about the Membership by passing `[membership]` in the `expand` parameter.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Membership, Plan, or Product on the returned Payment. Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, membership, user]`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User, Membership, Plan, or Product on the returned Payment. Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, plan, membership, user]`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per
parameters.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the User that made the Review(s), which will look like `user_*************`

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Product to find Reviews on, which will look like `prod_*************` or `pass_*************`

parameters.name: access_pass_id
parameters.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User or Product on the returned Review(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, user]`

get.description: Retrieves a specific Review, using its unique ID.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API key, which can be found on the Whop Business Dashboard. You must prepend your key with the word 'Bearer', which will look like `Bearer ***************************`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Review, which will look like `rev_*************`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether or not to expand the User or Product on the returned Review(s). Pass an array with each object(s) you want to expand, e.g. `[product, user]`

access_token.description: The token you will use to authenticate your user

id.description: The ID of the User, which will look like `user_*************`

profile_pic_url.description: An image URL of the User's profile photo, primarily pulled from Discord

username.description: The username or handle for the account

id.description: The ID of the social account on the respective platform

permission_level.description: A number based permission system. 0 = owner, 1 = admin, 2 = moderator

company.description: The Company this member is an Authorized User for

id.description: The ID of the Company, which will look like `biz_*************`

route.description: The URL route of the company. It will be whop.com/{route}

hostname.description: This is the custom domain connected to a Company

id.description: The ID of the Experience, which will look like `exp_*************`

description.description: A short description of what the Experience offers

properties.description: The properties of the Experience, used specifically for fields on different Experience types

products.description: The Products that are connected to this Experience. By default this will just an array of IDs of these Products, but you can expand it to get more information about each Product by passing `[product]` in the `expand` parameter.

id.description: The ID of the Product, which will look like `prod_*************` or `pass_*************`

created_at.description: The time at which the Product was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

experiences.description: The Experiences that are included in this Product

plans.description: The visible Plans that are included in this Product. Quick links and archived plans will not be included. There is a limit of 10 plans that can be returned for this field.

id.description: The ID of the Plan, which will look like `plan_*************`

product.description: The Product this Plan is tied to. By default this will just be the ID of the Product, but you can expand it to get more information about the Product by passing `[product]` in the `expand` parameter.

plan_type.description: Whether the Plan is a renewal or one-time purchase

release_method.description: The method the customer will use to gain access to this Plan's Product

visibility.description: The level of visibility of the Plan

billing_period.description: How often a user will get charged for their membership (if it is a renewal plan), in number of days

internal_notes.description: A nickname for the Plan set by the company and not visible to the customer

metadata.description: A polymorphic object containing information that can be user defined

direct_link.description: A URL that targets a customer on this specific Plan

renewal_price.description: The price to be charged for each successive billing period

initial_price.description: The price to be initially charged when a user first purchases the Plan

requirements.description: Represents the different restrictions (if any) in place for purchasing the Plan

release_method_settings.description: Configurable settings on how this Plan is released.

accepted_payment_methods.description: An array of payment methods that are accepted for this Plan

stock.description: The amount of stock left in the Plan

unlimited_stock.description: Whether or not the Plan offers unlimited stock

created_at.description: The time at which the Plan was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

access_pass.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.

id.description: The ID of the Product, which will look like `prod_*************` or `pass_*************`

created_at.description: The time at which the Product was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

current_page.description: The current page of the paginated response

total_page.description: The total number of pages in the paginated response

total_count.description: The total number of objects in the paginated response (automatically maxed out at 50)

id.description: The ID of the Membership, which will look like `mem_*************`

product.description: The Product attached to this Membership. By default this will just be the ID of the Product, but you can expand it to get more information about the Product by passing `[product]` in the `expand` parameter.

user.description: The User that owns this Membership. By default this will just be the ID of the User, but you can expand it to get more information about the User by passing `[user]` in the `expand` parameter.

plan.description: The Plan attached to this Membership. By default this will just be the ID of the Plan, but you can expand it to get more information about the Plan by passing `[plan]` in the `expand` parameter.

promo_code.description: The Promo Code used to purchase this Membership. By default this will just be the ID of the Promo Code, but you can expand it to get more information about the Promo Code by passing `[promo_code]` in the `expand` parameter.

email.description: The email of the User attached to this Membership

stripe_subscription_id.description: The Stripe Subscription ID attached to this Membership if it was checked out using Stripe

stripe_customer_id.description: The Stripe Customer ID attached to this Membership if it was checked out using Stripe

valid.description: Whether or not the Membership has a valid status

cancel_at_period_end.description: Whether or not this membership is scheduled to cancel at the end of the renewal period.

payment_processor.description: The payment processor used to pay for the Membership.

license_key.description: The license key of the Membership

quantity.description: The amount of items included in the Membership

wallet_address.description: The crypto wallet address used to pay for the Membership (if paid through the one-time ETH or renewal WETH Whop contracts)

custom_fields_responses.description: Questions and answers collected from the User at checkout

custom_fields_responses_v2.description: Questions and answers collected from the User at checkout

discord.description: The Discord account attached to this Membership

nft_tokens.description: Nft tokens attached to this Membership

expires_at.description: The time of when the Membership is set to go expired

renewal_period_start.description: The UTC timestamp of when the Membership will begin

renewal_period_end.description: The UTC timestamp of when the Membership will end

created_at.description: The time at which the Membership was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

manage_url.description: The URL to manage the Membership (top-up, cancel, etc.)

affiliate_page_url.description: Gives the url of the page with the user's affiliate code appended. Does not guarantee the user can affiliate anything on the page.

checkout_session.description: The ID of the checkout session (like `ch_***************`) used to purchase this membership, if any.

access_pass.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.

deliveries.description: A hash of deliveries for this membership, as a series of key value pairs of the experience id to the delivery id. Ex. { 'exp_*************': 'dlv_*************' }

telegram_account_id.description: The Whop ID of their connected Telegram account, if any.

id.description: The ID of the Promo Code, which will look like `promo_*************`

plans.description: The Plans this Promo Code is valid for. By default this will just be the IDs of the Plans, but you can expand it to get more information about the Plan by passing `[plan]` in the `expand` parameter.

amount_off.description: The amount off (percentage or flat amount) for the Promo Code.

base_currency.description: The monetary currency of the Promo Code.

code.description: The specific code used to apply the Promo Code at checkout.

new_users_only.description: Restricts Promo Code use to users who haven't purchased from the company before.

number_of_intervals.description: The number of billing cycles the Promo Code is applied for. By default, it is applied forever (0).

plan_ids.description: Please use `plans` instead, as this field is deprecated.

promo_type.description: Whether the Promo Code is a percentage or flat amount off.

status.description: Indicates if the Promo Code is live, disabled, or archived.

stock.description: The number of total uses remaining for the Promo Code.

unlimited_stock.description: Whether or not the Promo Code has unlimited uses.

uses.description: The amount of times the Promo Code has been used.

created_at.description: The time at which the Promo Code was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

expiration_datetime.description: The date/time of when the Promo Code expires.

metadata.description: A polymorphic object containing information that can be user defined

duration.description: The duration setting for the promo code.

existing_memberships_only.description: If true, the promo code can only be applied to existing memberships (post checkout).

id.description: The Discord account's user ID (~18 digits)

username.description: The Discord account's username, including the discriminator (Ex. John#1234)

current_holder.description: The current holder of the NFT

smart_contract.description: The smart contract that the NFT belongs to

contract_address.description: The blockchain address of the contract

contract_name.description: The name of the smart contract

stock.description: The amount of stock left in the Plan

unlimited_stock.description: Whether or not the Plan offers unlimited stock

visibility.description: The level of visibility of the Plan

allow_multiple_quantity.description: Marks whether customers can purchase multiple quantity of the Plan.

coinbase_commerce_accepted.description: Whether or not Coinbase Commerce payments are accepted.

expiration_days.description: The interval at which the Plan charges (expiration plans).

grace_period_days.description: The time period (in days) after a Membership expires where the customer can still top-up.

initial_price.description: The price to be initially charged when a user first purchases the Plan

internal_notes.description: A nickname for the Plan set by the company and not visible to the customer

one_per_user.description: Marks whether or not a Plan can be purchased multiple times by a user. Used most likely for free trial plans. Default is false

pegged_currencies.description: An array of currencies that will be pegged to the base currency

refillable.description: Marks whether an expiration Plan can/can't be topped-up.

short_link.description: The short link identifier for the Plan.

trial_period_days.description: The number of free trial days added before a renewal Plan.

metadata.description: A key value pair of metadata. Whatever you put on here will be assigned to any memberships that are created on this plan

paypal_accepted.description: Marks whether paypal payments are/aren't accepted.

oauth_update_company_plan.description: Update a plan using an experience access token

per.description: The number of resources to return per page. There is a limit of 50 results per page.

one_per_user.description: Whether or not a user can purchase multiple of the same Product

shuffleable.description: Whether or not license keys attached to this Product should be shuffleable by users (So if the key is leaked and the user does not want anyone else to use their key, they can have their key remade under the same membership)

product_id.description: The Plan's Product ID, which will look like `prod_*************` or `pass_*************`

access_pass_id.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.

plan_type.description: Whether the Plan is a renewal or one-time purchase

allow_multiple_quantity.description: Marks whether customers can purchase multiple quantity of the Plan.

billing_period.description: How often a user will get charged for their membership (if it is a renewal plan), in number of days

coinbase_commerce_accepted.description: Whether or not Coinbase Commerce payments are accepted.

custom_fields.description: An array of custom field objects.

expiration_days.description: The interval at which the Plan charges (expiration plans).

grace_period_days.description: The time period (in days) after a Membership expires where the customer can still top-up.

initial_price.description: The price to be initially charged when a user first purchases the Plan

one_per_user.description: Marks whether or not a Plan can be purchased multiple times by a user. Used most likely for free trial plans. Default is false

pegged_currencies.description: An array of currencies that will be pegged to the base currency

refillable.description: Marks whether an expiration Plan can/can't be topped-up.

release_method.description: The method the customer will use to gain access to this Plan's Product

release_method_settings.description: Configurable settings on how this Plan is released.

renewal_price.description: The price to be charged for each successive billing period

requirements.description: Represents the different restrictions (if any) in place for purchasing the Plan

short_link.description: The short link identifier for the Plan.

stock.description: The amount of stock left in the Plan

trial_period_days.description: The number of free trial days added before a renewal Plan.

unlimited_stock.description: Whether or not the Plan offers unlimited stock

visibility.description: The level of visibility of the Plan

metadata.description: A key value pair of metadata. Whatever you put on here will be assigned to any memberships that are created on this plan

internal_notes.description: A nickname for the Plan set by the company and not visible to the customer

short_link.description: The short link identifier for the Plan.

custom_password.description: The password that must be entered to use this plan. It will automatically be appended to the `direct_link`

stock.description: The amount of stock left in the Plan

trial_period_days.description: The number of free trial days added before a renewal Plan.

metadata.description: A key value pair of metadata. Whatever you put on here will be assigned to any memberships that are created on this plan

requirements.description: A key value pair of requirements.  By default, requirements will pull from the mimic_plan. Whichever ones are here will overwrite those

create_quick_link.description: Create a quick link for a plan

unlimited_stock.description: Whether or not the Plan offers unlimited stock

allow_multiple_quantity.description: Marks whether customers can purchase multiple quantity of the Plan.

coinbase_commerce_accepted.description: Whether or not Coinbase Commerce payments are accepted.

refillable.description: Marks whether an expiration Plan can/can't be topped-up.

trial_period_days.description: The number of free trial days added before a renewal Plan.

paypal_accepted.description: Marks whether paypal payments are/aren't accepted.

days.description: The number of free days the owner of the Membership should be given

metadata.description: A polymorphic object containing information that can be user defined
A polymorphic object containing information that can be user defined

id.description: The ID of the Payment, which will look like `pay_*************`

product.description: The Product this Payment is for. By default this will just be the ID of the Product, but you can expand it to get more information about the Product by passing `[product]` in the `expand` parameter.

membership.description: The Membership this Payment part of. By default this will just be the ID of the Membership, but you can expand it to get more information about the Membership by passing `[membership]` in the `expand` parameter.

affiliate_reward.description: The amount paid to the Affiliate for this Payment

plan.description: The Plan this Payment is under. By default this will just be the ID of the Plan, but you can expand it to get more information about the Plan by passing `[plan]` in the `expand` parameter.

user.description: The User who made the Payment. By default this will just be the ID of the User, but you can expand it to get more information about the User by passing `[user]` in the `expand` parameter.

final_amount.description: The total amount paid by the User, including any discounts or taxes

subtotal.description: The amount paid by the User, before any discounts or taxes

currency.description: The three letter currency the Payment was made in

last4.description: The last four digits of the credit/debit card used to make the Payment

payments_failed.description: The number of times the Payment has failed

payment_processor.description: Which platform was used to process the Payment

refunded_amount.description: The amount that was refunded to the User (if applicable)

crypto_tx_hash.description: The transaction hash for the Payment if it was made with a cryptocurrency

wallet_address.description: The crypto wallet address use to make this Payment

created_at.description: The time at which the Payment was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch. Does not necessarily reflect the time the Payment was successful.

paid_at.description: The time at which the Payment was successfully paid at. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

refunded_at.description: The UTC timestamp of the date the Payment was refunded (if applicable)

last_payment_attempt.description: The UTC timestamp of the last time the Payment was attempted

next_payment_attempt.description: The UTC timestamp of the next time the Payment will be attempted

access_pass.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.

id.description: The ID of the session, which will look like `ch_*************`

redirect_url.description: The URL the user will be navigated to after successfully completing a checkout with this session

affiliate_code.description: The code to apply as the affiliate for the transaction. Codes are a User object's `username` field.

metadata.description: The metadata that will be attached to the Membership upon successful purchase.

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan that the checkout session is associated with, which will look like `plan_*************`

purchase_url.description: The URL that the customer can use to purchase with this checkout session.

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan that the checkout session is associated with, which will look like `plan_*************`

affiliate_code.description: The code to apply as the affiliate for the transaction. Codes are a User object's `username` field.

redirect_url.description: The URL the user will be navigated to after successfully completing a checkout with this session

metadata.description: The metadata that will be attached to the Membership upon successful purchase.

amount_off.description: The amount off (percentage or flat amount) for the Promo Code.

base_currency.description: The monetary currency of the Promo Code.

code.description: The specific code used to apply the Promo Code at checkout.

promo_type.description: Whether the Promo Code is a percentage or flat amount off.

expiration_datetime.description: The date/time of when the Promo Code expires.

new_users_only.description: Restricts Promo Code use to users who haven't purchased from the company before.

number_of_intervals.description: The number of billing cycles the Promo Code is applied for. By default, it is applied forever (0).

plan_ids.description: The IDs of plans associated with the Promo Code. Use JSON as your content-type when setting this. Form encoded data will not work well with arrays.

stock.description: The number of total uses remaining for the Promo Code.

unlimited_stock.description: Whether or not the Promo Code has unlimited uses.

metadata.description: A key value pair of metadata. Whatever you put on here will be assigned to any memberships that are created on this plan

plan_ids.description: The IDs of plans associated with the Promo Code. Use JSON as your content-type when setting this. Form encoded data will not work well with arrays.

stock.description: The number of total uses remaining for the Promo Code.

unlimited_stock.description: Whether or not the Promo Code has unlimited uses.

status.description: Indicates if the Promo Code is live, disabled, or archived.

metadata.description: A key value pair of metadata. Whatever you put on here will be assigned to any memberships that are created on this plan

id.description: The ID of the Webhook, which will look like `hook_*************`

enabled.description: Whether or not the specified Webhook is enabled/turned on for new event notifications

url.description: The URL where new Webhook events will be sent to (e.g. https://website.com/api/whop-webhook)

created_at.description: The time at which the Webhook was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

url.description: The URL where new Webhook events will be sent to (e.g. https://website.com/api/whop-webhook)

enabled.description: Whether or not the specified Webhook is enabled/turned on for new event notifications

events.description: An array of the events the webhook will fire for. By default all events are enabled.

enabled.description: Whether or not the specified Webhook is enabled/turned on for new event notifications

url.description: The URL where new Webhook events will be sent to (e.g. https://website.com/api/whop-webhook)

id.description: The ID of the Review, which will look like `rev_*************`

user.description: The User that made this Review. By default this will just be the ID of the User, but you can expand it to get more information about the User by passing `[user]` in the `expand` parameter.

product.description: The Product attached to this Review. By default this will just be the ID of the Product, but you can expand it to get more information about the Product by passing `[product]` in the `expand` parameter.

stars.description: The number of starts the user gave your Product

description.description: The body or written description of this review

created_at.description: The time at which the Review was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

access_pass.description: Access Pass has been deprecated for Product. Please use product instead and do not use access_pass.
